job_description: Senior Software Engineer - job post Microsoft 7,730 reviews Redmond, WA 98052 $112,000 - $218,400 a year -  Full-time Microsoft 7,730 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $112,000 - $218,400 a year Job Type Full-time We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join a diverse team to help us build the next generation gaming ecosystem for both, gamers and creators. Who are we? Join us in the Gaming Ecosystem Organization (GEO) and be part of our mission to empower game creators to realize their dreams. The Growth, Engagement and Monetization (GEM) team within GEO has the goal to deliver the world’s best gaming store experiences to connect gamers and users to their favorite content, and empower Game Creators to be successful, from Xbox to PC to mobile and cloud. More on our mission: Modern games, and the gaming ecosystem overall, are only getting larger and more complex. To push ever higher with great interactive content, game studios need rich and flexible store experiences to reach out and expand their audiences in the gaming community. You will help craft the user experience of our gaming storefronts to empower game creators to display their games and content in new and novel ways in the console (Xbox), PC, web, mobile, cloud and in the games themselves. You will also work closely with industry leaders across hardware, software, and services, including game studios and Microsoft Gaming Partners. You will be a key part of the evolution and innovation taking place in our Gaming Storefronts. We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer who is passionate about building high quality reliable applications and experiences for our Xbox ecosystem that delightfully engage our gamers and help them connect with the content they love. As an engineer in our team, you’ll be working on improving and innovating our storefronts on multiple platforms. Addressing the growing needs of our gaming community, and using state-of-the-art technologies to help surface relevant content from our Microsoft Gaming first party & second party studios, as well as 3rd Party & Partner Studios. We look for diverse perspectives to help us build the best products and programs in the market. Responsibilities Key responsibilities As a member of the team, you will use your social skills to collaborate with internal and external developers and partners. You will design, build, test, debug and ship high quality code that is used by 100s of millions of users. Develop new and intuitive online experiences across our multiple platforms (Xbox consoles, web, Xbox (PC) App, mobile) to delight our users. You will have the opportunity to solve complex problems that allow for innovative features across multiple devices and services. You will be an active participant in a community of creativity, inclusion, and respect. You will be part of a world-class engineering team dedicated to the delivery of highly available and reliable 24x7 experiences and services for our millions of users in the gaming community and beyond. Qualifications Required/Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related technical discipline AND 4+ years technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python OR equivalent experience 4+ years building Web applications using JavaScript/TypeScript, React.js and/or other web development frameworks Additional or Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field AND 8+ years technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python OR Master's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field AND 6+ years technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python OR equivalent experience. Experience with one or more of Kubernetes, Linux, Azure, or AWS Software Engineering IC4 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $112,000 - $218,400 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $145,800 - $238,600 per year. Learn more about base pay ranges and pay equity: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Senior Software Engineer - job post ARiA Seattle, WA 98109 $100,000 - $250,000 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $100,000 - $250,000 a year Job Type Full-time ARiA applies broad interdisciplinary expertise in acoustics, machine learning, modeling & simulation, and signal processing toward innovative science and engineering research and development for a diverse set of government and corporate clients. Partnering with government, industry, and academia, ARiA solves critical challenges. ARiA is a small business where you can make a big difference. Our employees, including those at entry-level, are working together with the CIO of the Air Force to use cognitive computing to change the way the government acquires technology and working with top Navy leaders to use video games and simulation to change the way sailors are trained to use sonar. ARiA: Real Research. Real World.TM For more information, visit www.ariacoustics.com. ARiA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Position Description: ARiA is looking for highly motivated self-starters and low-ego team players to join our team as Senior Software Engineers. These positions are an opportunity to join a rapidly growing firm where you will engage deeply in challenging problems while developing cutting-edge technologies that address crucial needs. Strong candidates for this role at ARiA must value excellence and work with confidence, but without ego. Our engineers and scientists all have deep knowledge and exercise a high degree of leadership in their daily work. Members of the ARiA team have strongly-held, defensible ideas and advocate for what they believe is right, but are quick to exercise intellectual humility and acknowledge that they can often be wrong. Successful employees of ARiA are adept at working closely and collaboratively with team members and identifying and evaluating trade-offs when developing solutions. As a Senior Software Engineer you will perform a variety of software-engineering tasks working in close coordination with other ARiA scientists and engineers including design, development, testing, and deployment of: numerical-simulation software, scientific-visualization software, machine-learning software, and signal-processing software to support prototypes and products such as training tools integrated with real-time physics-based simulation and AI tools integrated with tactical systems. Responsible for: Algorithm and software design, development, research, and testing to support prototypes and products Supporting the transition of research algorithms to fielded systems Preparing documentation to summarize design and status of prototypes and products Assisting with in-field integration, testing, and support, with some local travel required Sample tasks: Developing an interface between a C++ underwater-acoustics physics engine and a video game for education and training Developing an interactive web-map frontend in JavaScript for a machine-learning tool that performs pixelwise segmentation of satellite images Developing real-time recording and variable-speed replay functionality for distributed command-and-control software with an hexagonal architecture implemented using GraphQL Mesh and enabling semantic queries of the recorded data using Elasticsearch Developing an interactive 3D visualization frontend in JavaScript (BabylonJS and/or CesiumJS) with physics-based simulation microservices for a web-deployed sonar education/training tool Developing a JavaScript backend for a scenario-design and management tool for players of a educational game and integration of that system with a learning-management system (LMS) Developing algorithms and software for a cloud-deployed cognitive tool that allows natural-language query of legal documents to answer user questions about government regulations and supporting the DevOps process for deployment of the prototype Requirements: Applicants selected for employment will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements, including U.S. citizenship, for access to sensitive information. Position summary T-Mobile is America’s supercharged Un-carrier, delivering an advanced 4G LTE and transformative nationwide 5G network that will offer reliable connectivity for all. Senior Engineers, Software located in Bellevue, WA will design, develop and unit test optimized and scalable Salesforce solutions across the T-Mobile Enterprise in a variety of new or existing, sometimes highly customized Orgs, in collaboration with architects and other software engineers. Position duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Architect, design, build, implement and test solutions in Salesforce.com leveraging Force.com, VisualForce, APEX, Aura, Lightning Web Components, Web Services, and APIs. Support cross systems integrations across native Salesforce eco system, as well as first-party APIs and data centers using SOAP, REST, BULK and Streaming APIs. (2) Working with Visualforce, APEX, and SOQL/SOSL and working with external APIs. (3) Utilizing Object Oriented Programming within Salesforce using APEX and Visual Force. (4) Working with Git Version Control Systems and Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) workflows within Salesforce using Copado. (5) Integrating Hadoop and Teradata into Salesforce using ETL Tools including Informatica and Jitterbit. (6) Working with Salesforce Analytics studio. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable space flight. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth. ( https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/diversity/inside-microsoft/annual-report ) Understanding roles at Microsoft The top of this page displays the role for which the base pay ranges apply – Software Engineering IC4. The way we define roles includes two things: discipline (the type of work) and career stage (scope and complexity). The career stage has two parts – the first identifies whether the role is a manager (M), an individual contributor (IC), an admin-technician-retail (ATR) job, or an intern. The second part identifies the relative seniority of the role – a higher number (or later letter alphabetically in the case of ATR) indicates greater scope and complexity. About our Client Our client is a serverless infrastructure company that has built a global state management platform for web developers. Their mission is to fundamentally change how software is built on the Internet and who gets to build it. They're looking for people who are passionate about improving the development experience for frontend engineers and who have strong opinions on what kinds of tools and workflows will remove barriers to getting things done. The early team at our client includes Principal Engineers and Engineering Directors who have led exabyte-scale storage projects, built custom global databases with trillions of records, and shipped desktop and mobile software onto billions of devices. They're a startup however and they're all excited about getting stuff done wherever is required in the stack. They've started to create something they believe is an entirely new and substantially better platform for teams of the future. They're eager to create the solution they wished they'd had for all those tricky frontend and backend problems they've wrestled to the ground over the years. They're motivated by the prospect of a new wave of teams using their product and excited to empower them to solve challenges that only recently were quite daunting. What excites them: They're looking for both junior and senior engineers who have a passion for building great things in a great environment. If you're highly-motivated, able to work independently, but also like to collaborate and work within a team, you're probably a good fit. Yes, they're building a state-of-the-art distributed database, so they have some very deep and very interesting systems challenges for infrastructure folks, but hopefully, folks who are also happy to also build a dashboard or work on developer SDKs. They're not just hiring infrastructure engineers however; most of their work is best applicable to general full-stack engineers with good taste and a product mindset. The Role: The Convex team has a lot of experience running large systems at scale but we have a growing infrastructure footprint across databases, servers, and devops. We are looking for a backend engineer to help build and maintain infrastructure for the future of Convex at scale. If you are passionate about building distributed systems and experienced with both designing and operating container infrastructure at scale, we would love to talk to you! What You’ll Do: Design, build, and maintain their global cloud infrastructure on AWS General ownership of SRE/DevOps which includes automating their monitoring and logging tools, developing traffic infrastructure for efficient and secure routing requests, managing release processing, versioning and CI/CD Establish reliability guidelines and ensuring systems meet our goals around durability, availability and performance Requirements: BS in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent technical experience 7+ years of backend engineering experience working on infrastructure, production engineering, SRE, or systems engineering Good understanding of best practices for system configuration, building internal systems from scratch, and deploying services Experience scaling in a high growth startup environment Ability to write high quality code (knowledge of Rust is a plus) Location: They view in-person time as essential to make quick strategic decisions, to build empathy and to form early team culture. But they also value that working from home allows productive heads-down execution, extra time with family, commute breaks, and schedule flexibility. So, they're currently following a three/two hybrid schedule: three days in the office and (optionally) two days at home. Therefore, interested candidates need to be either in the NYC or willing to relocate. Fully remote is not an option at this time. Benefits: They have competitive salaries, generous early-employee equity packages, excellent benefits, and lots of plants in the office! Most of all however, they're a group of friendly, highly-motivated people who love working together and hope that you'll love working with them too. Microsoft is embarking on a new effort to address the growing needs of employees around the world. We are building a product suite designed to address the fundamental shift in how people work, build their career, and find meaning in their workplace. Employee engagement is undergoing a fundamental shift in response to economic, demographic, and societal changes. People want to be excited about their work, be connected to their company culture, understand how to succeed, and feel supported across a spectrum of onboarding, skilling, coaching and mentoring. Our team is dedicated to examining the employee journey and delivering software and services to make it better. What is Viva Pulse? Viva Pulse is a new Viva module in development providing People-Science backed surveys to empower managers and project leaders to get regular input from their teams so they can take action in real time. Managers have fewer employee signals than they did in person, increasing the need for listening tools in a hybrid world. HR, not managers, historically controls employee feedback initiative, which may prevent managers from following up and tracking progress with their teams. Research indicates that employees will provide ongoing and meaningful responses only if they feel their feedback is being heard and actions. Viva Pulse will help managers and project leaders close the loop by providing actional recommendations to survey feedback. The Pulse product is part of the Employee Experience (EXP) organization, which includes Viva Pulse, Viva Learning, Viva Glint, and the Viva Horizontals teams. We run as a start-up, encouraging team members to share a sense of “founderism.” Team members engage directly with customers, iterate rapidly, and focus on solving the needs of employees around the world. Our culture is inclusive, casual, and high energy. Our team celebrates diverse backgrounds, and values passion for serving our customers. Our team has a strong sense of accountability and provides its members with opportunities for learning and career growth. Responsibilities Responsibilities As the Pulse Principal Group Engineering Manager, you will lead a 40 person software deveopment team responsible for architecting, developing, shipping, and running the Viva Pulse Module. We are looking for an experienced engineering leader with a proven history of shipping software and services, operational excellence, a learning mindset, and a bias for action. The ideal candidate is excited about early-stage products with a demonstrated track record of delivering end user focused solutions at scale. This leadership position will have a pivotal role in shaping Pulse in Viva, leading a foundational part of Microsoft's next big bet around Employee Experience. In today's blockchain ecosystem, each service is typically secured by its own token. The difficulty of bootstrapping new tokens often leads to too little capital to secure their services sufficiently. With EigenLabs, blockchain services can rely on Ethereum for security instead of their own token values. Stakers in the Ethereum proof-of-stake network can "re-stake" their assets with EigenLabs to secure other services and earn higher returns. Customers pay transaction fees for these strong security guarantees, making it possible for anyone to build innovative blockchain projects without large upfront capital raises. In order to do this work effectively, you will need to: Serve as the top technical leader on our most demanding projects, increasing our productivity and effectiveness by sharing your deep knowledge and experience Use your expert-level distributed systems engineering knowledge to design and implement production software, prototypes, and tools Propose and explain technical designs, trade-offs, and solutions Engage in the team's design and code reviews, standups, and agile development processes Assist in the career development of others, actively mentoring individuals and the community on advanced technical issues and helping managers guide the career growth of their team members Influence the company's strategy, product roadmap, and customer experiences.
